title: Pakistan province calls for 'climate diplomacy' with India as record smog chokes major city
summary: Pakistan's Punjab province has made an unprecedented call for cross-border collaboration with India to address severe air pollution affecting both countries. The deteriorating air quality in major cities poses significant health risks to millions of residents.
content:
A smog-choked province in eastern Pakistan has issued a rare plea for cross-border collaboration with India, as major cities in both countries endure severe air pollution that risks the health of millions.

Officials in Punjab, Pakistan's most populous province, are seeking cooperation with their Indian counterparts to combat the hazardous air quality that has blanketed the region. The pollution crisis has reached critical levels in major urban centers on both sides of the border.

The unprecedented diplomatic outreach highlights the growing recognition that environmental challenges transcend national boundaries and require joint solutions. The severe smog, a mixture of smoke and fog, has forced school closures, flight cancellations, and raised serious health concerns among residents.

Local authorities have reported that the air quality index in affected areas has reached dangerous levels, with particulate matter far exceeding safe limits set by the World Health Organization.
